column10: Vehicle Collision or Pedestrian Struck (with Injury)

column8:
1.Central Business District (2035 cases) is an extreme outlier
→ Nearly 2.5x higher than West End (803).
This is not just high — it’s disproportionately concentrated, indicating a strong commercial-density effect.

2.Theft from Vehicle spikes abnormally in Central Business (853 cases)
→ Much higher compared to all other neighbourhoods.
Shows strong correlation between parking/commercial activity and vehicle theft.

3.West End has high “Other Theft” (112) compared to similar-ranked areas
→ Indicates more mixed theft patterns, not just vehicle-related crime.

4.Mount Pleasant & Fairview show unusually high vehicle-related crimes
→ Suggests commuter/residential overlap zones.

5.Shaughnessy & South Cambie show low overall crime but relatively higher residential break-ins proportionally
→ Even low-crime areas may have targeted property risks.
